sentences.en: Airlines should stand or fall on their ability to attract passengers.
sentences.cn: 航空公司的成败应该取决于它们吸引乘客的能力。

sentences.en: Albert fell silent and turned his attention to his food.
sentences.cn: 艾伯特沉默下来，将注意力转移到食物上。

sentences.en: Almost without exception these women fall victim to exploitation.
sentences.cn: 这些女性几乎无一例外都受到了盘剥。

sentences.en: any commitment of resources is likely to fall foul of government cash limitations.
sentences.cn: 任何财力投入都可能与政府现金管制有矛盾。

sentences.en: critics and audiences fell over themselves to compliment him.
sentences.cn: 评论家和观众趋之若鹜地恭维他。

sentences.en: Enough rain had fallen to flood the grounds.
sentences.cn: 雨量很大，淹没了地面。

sentences.en: He claims he was made the fall guy for the affair.
sentences.cn: 他声称自己是这起事件的替罪羊。

sentences.en: He had fallen asleep on the sofa.
sentences.cn: 他在沙发上睡着了。

sentences.en: He had wrenched his ankle badly from the force of the fall.
sentences.cn: 他因摔倒而严重扭伤了脚踝。

sentences.en: He sustained serious neck injuries after he broke someone's fall.
sentences.cn: 有人坠落压在他身上，致使他颈部受重伤。

sentences.en: He was elected judge in the fall of 1991.
sentences.cn: 1991年秋他当选为法官。

sentences.en: I fell and hit my head.
sentences.cn: 我跌了一跤，撞到了头。

sentences.en: I think that I’ve fallen in love with Angela.
sentences.cn: 我觉得我爱上安杰拉了。

sentences.en: I’ll stay with her until she falls asleep .
sentences.cn: 我会一直陪着她，直到她睡着。

sentences.en: More than 100,000 people could fall ill after drinking contaminated water.
sentences.cn: 超过10万人可能会在饮用受到污染的水后患病。

sentences.en: once he knew what to look for, the theory fell quickly into place.
sentences.cn: 一旦他明白要找的东西，这理论很快就派上用场了。

sentences.en: once he knew what to look for, the theory fell quickly into place.
sentences.cn: 一旦他明白要找的东西，这理论很快就派上用场了。

sentences.en: Over a given period, the value of shares will rise and fall.
sentences.cn: 股票的价值在某一特定的时期内会有涨跌。

sentences.en: Peter was playing by the river when he fell in (= fell into the water ) .
sentences.cn: 彼得在河边玩着玩着，掉进了水里。

sentences.en: She fell ill with flu.
sentences.cn: 她患感冒，病倒了。

sentences.en: She flushed and her eyes fell (= she looked down ) .
sentences.cn: 她脸一红，垂下了眼帘。

sentences.en: Slowly but surely she started to fall in love with him.
sentences.cn: 虽然过程缓慢，但她无疑开始爱上他了。

sentences.en: Sometimes things have to fall apart to make way for better things.
sentences.cn: 有时候要到达谷底，才会慢慢变好。

sentences.en: The book fell from his hands.
sentences.cn: 书从他手上跌落。

sentences.en: The built-in safety device compensates for a fall in water pressure.
sentences.cn: 该内置式安全装置在水压下降时能提供保护。

sentences.en: The cost of electricity from coal-fired stations is expected to fall.
sentences.cn: 用煤作燃料的火力发电站的成本有望降低。

sentences.en: The fall in inflation is the silver lining of the prolonged recession.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀的下降是长期经济衰退中的一线转机。

sentences.en: The room had fallen silent.
sentences.cn: 整个房间都变得静悄悄的。

sentences.en: The tree was about to fall.
sentences.cn: 那棵树快要倒下了。

sentences.en: their marriage is likely to fall apart.
sentences.cn: 他们的婚姻有可能破裂。

sentences.en: There was a sharp fall in the value of the pound.
sentences.cn: 英镑大幅贬值。

sentences.en: they normally fell back on one of three arguments.
sentences.cn: 他们通常借助三个论据之一。

sentences.en: Whenever I get into a relationship, I always fall madly in love.
sentences.cn: 我每次谈恋爱都深陷其中，无法自拔。

words.tran_cn: 堕落的；落下来的；陷落的
[林] 一季所伐的木材；折缝；兽皮
掉下；摔倒；下垂；变坏（fall的过去式）

phrases.tran_cn: 到期；集合；排队；倒塌；与某人在一起
与他人一致；符合行为规范

phrases.phrase: fall in (或 out of) love (with someone)

phrases.tran_cn: （一系列事件或事实）开始明晰（或衔接）起来
减少；跌落；下降；离开；衰退
发生；脱落；争吵；离队；结果是

phrases.phrase: fall over oneself to do something

phrases.tran_cn: (北美，非正式)代人受过；当替罪羊

trans.tran_cn: 落下，瀑布，秋季，垮台，减少，人类堕落，(摔跤中)双肩着地
trans.tran_en: a reduction in the amount, level, price etc of something
to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position
to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position

trans.tran_cn: 落下，摔倒，下垂，减少，垮台，陷落，战死，陷入(某种状态)，发生，属于
trans.tran_en: to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position
